verses.english: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.
These are the verses of the clear Book.

verses.arabic: لَعَلَّكَ بَـٰخِعٌ نَّفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their disbelief.

verses.arabic: إِن نَّشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَـٰقُهُمْ لَهَا خَـٰضِعِينَ
verses.english: If We willed, We could send down upon them a ˹compelling˺ sign from the heavens, leaving their necks bent in ˹utter˺ submission to it.

verses.arabic: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِم مِّن ذِكْرٍ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا۟ عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.english: Whatever new reminder comes to them from the Most Compassionate, they always turn away from it.

verses.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا۟ فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنۢبَـٰٓؤُا۟ مَا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ يَسْتَهْزِءُونَ
verses.english: They have certainly denied ˹the truth˺, so they will soon face the consequences of their ridicule.

verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ إِلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.english: Have they failed to look at the earth, ˹to see˺ how many types of fine plants We have caused to grow in it?

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

verses.arabic: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئْتِ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
verses.english: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the wrongdoing people—
the people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear ˹Allah˺?”

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.english: He replied, “My Lord! I fear that they will reject me.

verses.arabic: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِى وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِى فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَـٰرُونَ
verses.english: And ˹so˺ my heart will be broken and my tongue will be tied. So send Aaron along ˹as a messenger˺.

verses.arabic: وَلَهُمْ عَلَىَّ ذَنۢبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.english: Also, they have a charge against me,<sup foot_note=77083>1</sup> so I fear they may kill me.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَٱذْهَبَا بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.english: Allah responded, “Certainly not! So go, both of you, with Our signs. We will be with you, listening.

verses.arabic: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: Go to Pharaoh and say, ‘We are messengers from the Lord of all worlds,
˹commanded to say:˺ ‘Let the Children of Israel go with us.’’”

verses.arabic: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
verses.english: Pharaoh protested, “Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed several years of your life in our care?

verses.arabic: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِى فَعَلْتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
verses.english: Then you did what you did,<sup foot_note=77084>1</sup> being ˹utterly˺ ungrateful!”

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَآ إِذًا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.english: Moses replied, “I did it then, lacking guidance.

verses.arabic: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِى رَبِّى حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِى مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.english: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and made me one of the messengers.

verses.arabic: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَىَّ أَنْ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.english: How can that be a ‘favour,’ of which you remind me, when ˹it was only because˺ you ˹have˺ enslaved the Children of Israel?”
Pharaoh asked, “And what is ‘the Lord of all worlds’?”

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
verses.english: Moses replied, “˹He is˺ the Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything in between, if only you had sure faith.”
Pharaoh said to those around him, “Did you hear ˹what he said˺?”
Moses added, “˹He is˺ your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.english: Pharaoh said ˹mockingly˺, “Your messenger, who has been sent to you, must be insane.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلْمَشْرِقِ وَٱلْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَآ ۖ إِن كُنتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.english: Moses responded: “˹He is˺ the Lord of the east and west, and everything in between, if only you had any sense.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذْتَ إِلَـٰهًا غَيْرِى لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمَسْجُونِينَ
verses.english: Pharaoh threatened, “If you take any other god besides me, I will certainly have you imprisoned.”
Moses responded, “Even if I bring you a clear proof?”

verses.arabic: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: Pharaoh demanded, “Bring it then, if what you say is true.”

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
verses.english: So he threw down his staff and—behold!—it became a real snake.

verses.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
verses.english: Then he drew his hand ˹out of his collar˺ and it was ˹shining˺ white for all to see.

verses.arabic: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.english: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, “He is indeed a skilled magician,

verses.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُم بِسِحْرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.english: who seeks to drive you from your land by his magic. So what do you propose?”

verses.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبْعَثْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
verses.english: They replied, “Let him and his brother wait and dispatch mobilizers to all cities
to bring you every skilled magician.”
So the magicians were assembled at the set time on the appointed day.
And the people were asked, “Will you join the gathering,

verses.arabic: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.english: so that we may follow the magicians if they prevail?”

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا۟ لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
verses.english: When the magicians came, they asked Pharaoh, “Shall we have a ˹suitable˺ reward if we prevail?”

verses.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.english: He replied, “Yes, and you will then certainly be among those closest to me.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلْقُوا۟ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلْقُونَ
verses.english: Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you wish to cast.”

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَوْا۟ حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا۟ بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبُونَ
verses.english: So they cast down their ropes and staffs, saying, “By Pharaoh’s might, it is we who will surely prevail.”

verses.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.english: Then Moses threw down his staff, and—behold!—it devoured the objects of their illusion!
So the magicians fell down, prostrating.
They declared, “We ˹now˺ believe in the Lord of all worlds—
the Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمْ لَهُۥ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِى عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.english: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic, but soon you will see. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, then crucify you all.”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.english: They responded, “˹That would be˺ no harm! Surely to our Lord we will ˹all˺ return.

verses.arabic: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَـٰيَـٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: We really hope that our Lord will forgive our sins, as we are the first to believe.”

verses.arabic: ۞ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِىٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
verses.english: And We inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants at night, for you will surely be pursued.”
Then Pharaoh sent mobilizers to all cities,
˹and said,˺ “These ˹outcasts˺ are just a handful of people,
who have really enraged us,
but we are all on the alert.”
So We lured the tyrants<sup foot_note=77085>1</sup> out of ˹their˺ gardens, springs,
treasures, and splendid residences.
So it was. And We awarded it ˹all˺ to the Children of Israel.
And so they pursued them at sunrise.

verses.arabic: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَـٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
verses.english: When the two groups came face to face, the companions of Moses cried out, “We are overtaken for sure.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ كَلَّآ ۖ إِنَّ مَعِىَ رَبِّى سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.english: Moses reassured ˹them˺, “Absolutely not! My Lord is certainly with me—He will guide me.”

verses.arabic: فَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْبَحْرَ ۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَٱلطَّوْدِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ
verses.english: So We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your staff,” and the sea was split, each part was like a huge mountain.
We drew the pursuers to that place,
and delivered Moses and those with him all together.
Then We drowned the others.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Abraham,

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِۦ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.english: when he questioned his father and his people, “What is that you worship ˹besides Allah˺?”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَـٰكِفِينَ
verses.english: They replied, “We worship idols, to which we are fully devoted.”
Abraham asked, “Can they hear you when you call upon them?
Or can they benefit or harm you?”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ بَلْ وَجَدْنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.english: They replied, “No! But we found our forefathers doing the same.”
Abraham responded, “Have you ˹really˺ considered what you have been worshipping—
you and your ancestors?

verses.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِّىٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: They are ˹all˺ enemies to me, except the Lord of all worlds.
˹He is˺ the One Who created me, and He ˹alone˺ guides me.
˹He is˺ the One Who provides me with food and drink.
And He ˹alone˺ heals me when I am sick.
And He ˹is the One Who˺ will cause me to die, and then bring me back to life.

verses.arabic: وَٱلَّذِىٓ أَطْمَعُ أَن يَغْفِرَ لِى خَطِيٓـَٔتِى يَوْمَ ٱلدِّينِ
verses.english: And He is ˹the One˺ Who, I hope, will forgive my flaws<sup foot_note=77086>1</sup> on Judgment Day.”

verses.arabic: رَبِّ هَبْ لِى حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِى بِٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
verses.english: “My Lord! Grant me wisdom, and join me with the righteous.

verses.arabic: وَٱجْعَل لِّى لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرِينَ
verses.english: Bless me with honourable mention among later generations.<sup foot_note=77087>1</sup>
Make me one of those awarded the Garden of Bliss.

verses.arabic: وَٱغْفِرْ لِأَبِىٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.english: Forgive my father, for he is certainly one of the misguided.
And do not disgrace me on the Day all will be resurrected—

verses.arabic: يَوْمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.english: the Day when neither wealth nor children will be of any benefit.

verses.arabic: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
verses.english: Only those who come before Allah with a pure heart ˹will be saved˺.”<sup foot_note=77088>1</sup>
˹On that Day˺ Paradise will be brought near to the God-fearing,
and the Hellfire will be displayed to the deviant.

verses.arabic: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.english: And it will be said to them, “Where are those you used to worship

verses.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلْ يَنصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنتَصِرُونَ
verses.english: besides Allah? Can they help you or even help themselves?”
Then the idols will be hurled headlong into Hell, along with the deviant
and the soldiers of Iblîs,<sup foot_note=77089>1</sup> all together.
There the deviant will cry while disputing with their idols,

verses.arabic: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
verses.english: “By Allah! We were clearly mistaken,
when we made you equal to the Lord of all worlds.
And none led us astray other than the wicked.
Now we have none to intercede for us,
nor a close friend.

verses.arabic: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: If only we could have a second chance, then we would be believers.”

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
The people of Noah rejected the messengers<sup foot_note=77090>1</sup>

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: when their brother Noah said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.
So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.
So fear Allah, and obey me.”
They argued, “How can we believe in you, when you are followed ˹only˺ by the lowest of the low?”<sup foot_note=77091>1</sup>

verses.arabic: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِى بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: He responded, “And what knowledge do I have of what they do?

verses.arabic: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّى ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
verses.english: Their judgment is with my Lord, if you had any sense!
I am not going to expel the believers.
I am only sent with a clear warning.”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمَرْجُومِينَ
verses.english: They threatened, “If you do not desist, O  Noah, you will surely be stoned ˹to death˺.”
Noah prayed, “My Lord! My people have truly rejected me.

verses.arabic: فَٱفْتَحْ بَيْنِى وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِى وَمَن مَّعِىَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers with me.”

verses.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ ٱلْمَشْحُونِ
verses.english: So We saved him and those with him in the fully loaded Ark.
Then afterwards We drowned the rest.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
The people of ’Âd rejected the messengers

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: when their brother Hûd said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.
So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.
˹Why˺ do you build a landmark on every high place in vanity,
and construct castles, as if you are going to live forever,
and act so viciously when you attack ˹others˺?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
Fear the One Who has provided you with ˹the good˺ things you know:
He provided you with cattle, and children,
and gardens, and springs.

verses.arabic: إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.english: I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous day.”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيْنَآ أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلْوَٰعِظِينَ
verses.english: They responded, “It is all the same to us whether you warn ˹us˺ or not.
This is simply the tradition of our predecessors.
And we will never be punished.”

verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَـٰهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: So they rejected him, and ˹so˺ We destroyed them. Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
The people of Thamûd rejected the messengers

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَـٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: when their brother Ṣâliḥ said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.
So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.
Do you think you will be ˹forever˺ left secure in what you have here:
amid gardens and springs,
and ˹various˺ crops, and palm trees ˹loaded˺ with tender fruit;
to carve homes in the mountains with great skill?
So fear Allah, and obey me.
And do not follow the command of the transgressors,

verses.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.english: who spread corruption throughout the land, never setting things right.”
They replied, “You are simply bewitched!

verses.arabic: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: You are only a human being like us, so bring forth a sign if what you say is true.”

verses.arabic: قَالَ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٌ لَّهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَّعْلُومٍ
verses.english: Ṣâliḥ said, “Here is a camel. She will have her turn to drink as you have yours, each on an appointed day.

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.english: And do not ever touch her with harm, or you will be overtaken by the torment of a tremendous day.”
But they killed her, becoming regretful.

verses.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: So the punishment overtook them. Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
The people of Lot rejected the messengers

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.
So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.
Why do you ˹men˺ lust after fellow men,<sup foot_note=77092>1</sup>

verses.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُم مِّنْ أَزْوَٰجِكُم ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
verses.english: leaving the wives that your Lord has created for you? In fact, you are a transgressing people.”

verses.arabic: قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ تَنتَهِ يَـٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.english: They threatened, “If you do not desist, O  Lot, you will surely be expelled.”
Lot responded, “I am truly one of those who despise your ˹shameful˺ practice.
My Lord! Save me and my family from ˹the consequences of˺ what they do.”
So We saved him and all of his family,
except an old woman,<sup foot_note=77093>1</sup> who was one of the doomed.
Then We utterly destroyed the rest,

verses.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
verses.english: pouring upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned!

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
The residents of the Forest rejected the messengers

verses.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.english: when Shu’aib said to them,<sup foot_note=77094>1</sup> “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?
I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.
So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِىَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
verses.english: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

verses.arabic: ۞ أَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْمُخْسِرِينَ
verses.english: Give full measure, and cause no loss ˹to others˺.
Weigh with an even balance,

verses.arabic: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.english: and do not defraud people of their property. Nor go about spreading corruption in the land.
And fear the One Who created you and ˹all˺ earlier peoples.”
They replied, “You are simply bewitched!

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِّثْلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
verses.english: Also, you are only a human being like us, and we think you are indeed a liar.

verses.arabic: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
verses.english: So cause ˹deadly˺ pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if what you say is true.”
Shu’aib responded, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”

verses.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.english: So they rejected him, and ˹so˺ were overtaken by the torment of the day of the ˹deadly˺ cloud.<sup foot_note=77095>1</sup> That was really a torment of a tremendous day.

verses.arabic: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.
And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.
This is certainly a revelation from the Lord of all worlds,
which the trustworthy spirit ˹Gabriel˺ brought down
into your heart ˹O Prophet˺—so that you may be one of the warners—
in a clear Arabic tongue.
And it has indeed been ˹foretold˺ in the Scriptures of those before.

verses.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُمْ ءَايَةً أَن يَعْلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَـٰٓؤُا۟ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.english: Was it not sufficient proof for the deniers that it has been recognized by the knowledgeable among the Children of Israel?<sup foot_note=77096>1</sup>
Had We revealed it to a non-Arab,

verses.arabic: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيْهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: who would then recite it to the deniers ˹in fluent Arabic˺, still they would not have believed in it!
This is how We allow denial ˹to steep˺ into the hearts of the wicked.

verses.arabic: لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ ٱلْأَلِيمَ
verses.english: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment,
which will take them by surprise when they least expect ˹it˺.
Then they will cry, “Can we be allowed more time?”
Do they ˹really˺ seek to hasten Our torment?
Imagine ˹O Prophet˺ if We allowed them enjoyment for years,
then there came to them what they had been threatened with:

verses.arabic: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ
verses.english: would that enjoyment be of any benefit to them ˹at all˺?

verses.arabic: وَمَآ أَهْلَكْنَا مِن قَرْيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
verses.english: We have never destroyed a society without warners
to remind ˹them˺, for We would never wrong ˹anyone˺.
It was not the devils who brought this ˹Quran˺ down:
it is not for them ˹to do so˺, nor can they,
for they are strictly barred from ˹even˺ overhearing ˹it˺.<sup foot_note=77097>1</sup>

verses.arabic: فَلَا تَدْعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.english: So do not ever call upon any other god besides Allah, or you will be one of the punished.
And warn ˹all, starting with˺ your closest relatives,

verses.arabic: وَٱخْفِضْ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.english: and be gracious to the believers who follow you.

verses.arabic: فَإِنْ عَصَوْكَ فَقُلْ إِنِّى بَرِىٓءٌ مِّمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.english: But if they disobey you, say, “I am certainly free of what you do.”
Put your trust in the Almighty, Most Merciful,
Who sees you when you rise ˹for prayer at night˺,
as well as your movements ˹in prayer˺ along with ˹fellow˺ worshippers.
He ˹alone˺ is indeed the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

verses.arabic: هَلْ أُنَبِّئُكُمْ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينُ
verses.english: Shall I inform you of whom the devils ˹actually˺ descend upon?
They descend upon every sinful liar,
who gives an ˹attentive˺ ear ˹to half-truths˺, mostly passing on sheer lies.<sup foot_note=77098>1</sup>
As for poets, they are followed ˹merely˺ by deviants.

verses.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّهُمْ فِى كُلِّ وَادٍ يَهِيمُونَ
verses.english: Do you not see how they rant in every field,<sup foot_note=77099>1</sup>
only saying what they never do?

verses.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ وَذَكَرُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرًا وَٱنتَصَرُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا ظُلِمُوا۟ ۗ وَسَيَعْلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓا۟ أَىَّ مُنقَلَبٍ يَنقَلِبُونَ
verses.english: Except those who believe, do good, remember Allah often, and ˹poetically˺ avenge ˹the believers˺ after being wrongfully slandered. The wrongdoers will come to know what ˹evil˺ end they will meet.
